title: California vs. Supply Chains
sub_head: How to slow the movement of goods from ship to shelf.
body:
Think of the least productive policy to address an issue in public affairs and there’s a good chance you’ll find it is already being implemented in California. Now think specifically of the last thing you would do to speed goods from busy West Coast ports to the nation’s store shelves.
If you guessed making it more difficult and expensive to operate commercial trucks in the Golden State, give yourself a prize.
